text: It's the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
author: Lao Tzu

text: It is better to light a single candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.
author: Robin Sharma

text: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Be brave enough to suck at something new.
author: Unknown

text: The opportunity of defeating the enemy is provided by the enemy himself.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Circumstances rule men; men do not rule circumstances.
author: Herodotus

text: Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: To acquire true self power you have to feel beneath no one, be immune to criticism and be fearless.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: If you throw away all thoughts of attainment, you will then come to see the real purpose of your quest.
author: Seungsahn

text: When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: If life is a video game, the graphics are great, but the plot is confusing and the tutorial is way too long.
author: Elon Musk

text: Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.
author: Tony Robbins

text: In life you need either inspiration or desperation.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Time goes from present to past.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: Beware of false knowledge, it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Don't try to steer the river.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
author: Confucius

text: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: We love the things we love for what they are.
author: Robert Frost

text: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
author: Alfred Adler

text: No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell.
author: Carl Jung

text: I live by letting things happen.
author: Dogen

text: No man is more cheated than the selfish man.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: You change the world by being yourself.
author: Yoko Ono

text: To perceive is to suffer.
author: Aristotle

text: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
author: Plato

text: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.
author: Buddha

text: If you want to achieve anything in this world, you have to get used to the idea that not everyone will like you.
author: Simon Sinek

text: You can't get to a place that you don't believe exists.
author: Unknown

text: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart wants what the heart wants.
author: Stephen King

text: Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
author: Epictetus

text: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: Obstacles can't stop you. Problems can't stop you. Most of all, other people can't stop you. Only you can stop you.
author: Jeffrey Gitomer

text: Never settle for the crumbs of life.
author: Og Mandino

text: We must not be afraid of dreaming the seemingly impossible if we want the seemingly impossible to become a reality.
author: Vaclav Havel

text: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
author: Voltaire

text: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The older you get, the better you get. Unless you're a banana.
author: Betty White
